message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this fantastic product at a price of $14,000. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really love it!
Hello Alice, thanks for the offer, but that price is a little too high for me.  Would you consider $10,000?

I understand you're looking for a better deal, Bob. I can see that you really want this product, so I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I'll offer it to you for $12,500. It's a fair price, and I think you'll find it's worth every penny!
Alice, I appreciate you coming down a bit, but I'm still not quite there. How about we split the difference from our last offers and call it $11,250?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $11,250. I'm willing to come down a bit more, but I need to make a profit. I'll offer it to you for $12,750. It's a fair price, considering the value it brings to you.
Alice, it seems like we're getting closer.  How about we settle this right now at $12,000?  That's a fair compromise.
I'm glad we're close, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $12,000. I'll make one last offer: $13,000. It's the highest I'm willing to go, and I think it's still a great deal for you.
Alice, I appreciate you working with me, but $13,000 is too high.  I'm willing to pay $12,250, but that's my final offer.

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I've already come down quite a bit from my initial offer. I'm willing to meet you at $12,500, but I'm not going any lower than that. It's the lowest price I can offer and still make a profit.
